title: First Registration
author: First Registration
content: One thing to mention in particular was the bear market a few days ago. Then the price of Bitcoin has decreased due to the market being down. But now, despite being in a bull market, why is the price of Bitcoin decreasing now? Hope the experienced will tell.

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: Quote from: First Registration on August 21, 2022, 04:43:33 PMOne thing to mention in particular was the bear market a few days ago. Then the price of Bitcoin has decreased due to the market being down. But now, despite being in a bull market, why is the price of Bitcoin decreasing now? Hope the experienced will tell.yes obviously there is always an increase from every price that goes down and vice versa, this is the crypto world everyone can speculate in their own way, of course the bitcoin price will go up again, you can go to my thread here about what is a 4 year crypto cycle and maybe you will get a lot of speculation and analysis there

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Quote from: First Registration on August 21, 2022, 04:43:33 PMOne thing to mention in particular was the bear market a few days ago. Then the price of Bitcoin has decreased due to the market being down. But now, despite being in a bull market, why is the price of Bitcoin decreasing now? Hope the experienced will tell.Sorry to burst the bubble but we are not in a bull market yet.  The recent rally of Bitcoin is just a relief rally that was long overdue, meaning we just experienced another lower high where the price of Bitcoin has some recovery but not enough to reverse the market trend.  The reason why the bitcoin price is decreasing is that there is not enough demand to resist the selling side.

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: You can be almost certain that some day there will be a large bull run. But it's likely not going to happen soon. Not in this year, maybe not even in the next one. If you look at past history, bear markets last for a long time, around 2 years. And we're not even one full year away from the ATH.But this is good, because bear market is the time for buying Bitcoin. Just don't forget to sell when the bull market will come, otherwise you will have to wait again for a bull run.

Hope the experienced will tell.a few years ago when I met bitcoin the price was 400$, then the price went up to 3000$, I remember many people were happy but the price later dropped a lot, after some time the price went up a lot to 5000$, then the people were wondering if the price would be able to break the 10,000$, there were people who even said that the price would never break the 10,000$, but the price managed to reach 20,000$, and then it dropped to 3100$ and it went years without reaching again at 20,000$ that even people said it would never reach 20,000$ again, incredible that the price reached 67,000$, so you are still asking this question?

Hope the experienced will tell.I hope that you understand too that the market is unpredictable, no one knows when the bull or bear market season. I tend to agree with the comments above, sorry but we're not yet in a bull trend right now Bitcoin still struggling for the price to pump up.  Every time when there's a resistance, it will not hold it longer there's always a correction. But we're on the same side, hoping that Bitcoin will have a bull market trend within this year, I suggest you not look at Bitcoin price daily in a chart, instead, invest for a long-term purpose.  Or, it's time for you to invest since there's a correction happening on Bitcoin price.

comments.body: Quote from: First Registration on August 21, 2022, 04:43:33 PMOne thing to mention in particular was the bear market a few days ago. Then the price of Bitcoin has decreased due to the market being down. But now, despite being in a bull market, why is the price of Bitcoin decreasing now? Hope the experienced will tell.There's no confirmation of bull market, what you have seen is just an uptrend that tries to break the resistance but failed to do so. Bull market is not just a simple pump, because the whole market will be pump by that time and for sure it will be an expensive pump. Bitcoin will rise again eventually, you just need to wait patiently and invest wisely, this is the only thing you can do for now so you can win more once the market recovers and pump into a bull market again.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Quote from: First Registration on August 21, 2022, 04:43:33 PMOne thing to mention in particular was the bear market a few days ago. Then the price of Bitcoin has decreased due to the market being down. But now, despite being in a bull market, why is the price of Bitcoin decreasing now? Hope the experienced will tell.The lowest that bitcoin has reached after the recent bull run was $17k and we're at $21k and it has reached likely the highest of $24k. It's still not that far from the lowest. So, if you're telling us that we're already in the bull run, then that's likely just a trap. Whenever we see the price of bitcoin goes up, we're already speculating that it's the actual bull run. But in all reality, it's not yet.As it decreases now, it's a normal fluctuation of bitcoin so, if you think that we should be that high already then you're wrong with that speculation.

comments.author: BitcoinBunny
comments.body: It may bounce around and get back to 25K again but it will not go up from there for a long time I suspect. At least 6-12 months.The stock market and the housing market are in the toilet and we are only at the beginning of a recession in much of the west. It could last years or it may last 6-12 months if central banks get the money printers out again.BTC is simply not yet seen as the inflation protection asset that it can be used as. Still very much as a speculation for most investors.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: At the very least, you shouldn't expect it to happen in the next year. This kind of sentiment has always followed Bitcoin after a dump, say after the dump right after CoVid happened. From there you can always see that Bitcoin pumped to high prices once again after a few years. We've only been bearish for what, a year or so at most? I wouldn't expect it to be gone with that amount of time, at the very least 1-2 years. Quote from: First Registration on August 21, 2022, 04:43:33 PMOne thing to mention in particular was the bear market a few days ago. Even if we were hovering around $25k earlier, the market movement was rather slow and steady, even seeing dips like what you were talking about. Zoom out, look at the bigger picture.

comments.author: Fundamentals Of
comments.body: What are you saying? A bear market doesn't just happen in a day or a few days. Just because the price falls in a few days doesn't mean it is a bear market already. The same with bull market. The market right now is still bearish. So even if the price experiences some increases, it doesn't mean we are already in a bull market. We are still in the middle of the bear market. So expect that there will be no strong rallies that happen. Don't interpret short-term movements in the price as a sign of the overall condition of the market.
